original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The Lord will not let the godly starve to death, but He refuses_

_to satisfy the craving of the wicked." _(Pro. 10:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

These statements are not intended to apply universally to all people

in every situation. For example, some good people do go hungry.

Rather they are intended to communicate the general truth that the

life of the person who seeks God is better in the long run than the

life of the wicked person---a life that leads to ruin. A proverb like

this assumes a just government that cares for the poor and needy.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the practical wisdom for

godly living at every stage of life, that is found in these proverbs.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: These statements are not intended to apply universally to all people in every situation. For example, some good people do go hungry. Rather they are intended to communicate the general truth that the life of the person who seeks God is better in the long run than the life of the wicked person---a life that leads to ruin. A proverb like this assumes a just government that cares for the poor and needy.
original_verse_text: "The Lord will not let the godly starve to death, but He refuses to satisfy the craving of the wicked. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your faithful provision and care. As Your Word declares, You do not forsake the righteous nor allow them to go hungry. Help us to trust in Your unfailing love and to seek first Your kingdom, knowing that You will supply our every need according to Your riches in glory. May our lives be a testament to Your goodness and justice, that others may see and be drawn to the hope found in You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: These statements are not intended to apply universally to all people in every situation. For example, some good people do go hungry. Rather they are intended to communicate the general truth that the life of the person who seeks God is better in the long run than the life of the wicked person---a life that leads to ruin. A proverb like this assumes a just government that cares for the poor and needy.
subject: Seeking God's Way Leads
verse_text: "The Lord will not let the godly starve to death, but He refuses to satisfy the craving of the wicked. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Lazy people are soon poor, hard workers get rich._

_A wise youth works hard all summer; a youth who_

_sleeps away the hour of opportunity brings shame." _(Pro. 10:4-5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Very day has 24 hours of opportunity, to grow, serve, and be

productive. Yet it is so easy to waste time, letting life slip

from our grasp. Let us refuse to be a lazy person, sleeping

or flittering away the hours meant for productive work. Let

us see time as God's gift, and seize every opportunity to live

diligently for Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would seek to grasp every opportunity

to grow and serve You in a productive way. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Very day has 24 hours of opportunity, to grow, serve, and be productive. Yet it is so easy to waste time, letting life slip from our grasp. Let us refuse to be a lazy person, sleeping or flittering away the hours meant for productive work. Let us see time as God's gift, and seize every opportunity to live diligently for Him.
original_verse_text: "Lazy people are soon poor, hard workers get rich. A wise youth works hard all summer; a youth who sleeps away the hour of opportunity brings shame. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing the precious gift of time You have entrusted to us. Forgive us for the times we have squandered this gift, giving in to laziness and complacency. Help us to be diligent and hardworking, like the ant in Proverbs, that we may make the most of every opportunity to grow, serve, and live productively for Your glory. May we see each day as a chance to honor You through our faithful stewardship of the hours You have given. Amen.
reflection: Very day has 24 hours of opportunity, to grow, serve, and be productive. Yet it is so easy to waste time, letting life slip from our grasp. Let us refuse to be a lazy person, sleeping or flittering away the hours meant for productive work. Let us see time as God's gift, and seize every opportunity to live diligently for Him.
subject: Seize the Gift of Time
verse_text: "Lazy people are soon poor, hard workers get rich. A wise youth works hard all summer; a youth who sleeps away the hour of opportunity brings shame. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"People with integrity have firm footing, but those who follow

crooked paths will slip and fall." (Pro. 10:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This refers to all lies, especially those told under oath. God truly

honors honesty! DISHONESTY cones easily, especially when complete

honesty could, cost us something, make us uncomfortable, or put us

in an unfavorable light.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would guide me to be honest

under all circumstances, I pray this in the name of our Lord and
Savior

Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: This refers to all lies, especially those told under oath. God truly honors honesty! DISHONESTY cones easily, especially when complete honesty could, cost us something, make us uncomfortable, or put us in an unfavorable light.
original_verse_text: "People with integrity have firm footing, but those who follow crooked paths will slip and fall. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the temptation to be dishonest that so often plagues us. Help us to walk with integrity, as Your Word instructs, speaking the truth and rejecting all falsehood. May our words and actions reflect the light of Your truth, that we may live in a manner worthy of Your calling. Grant us the courage to be honest, even when it is difficult. We desire to honor You in all things. Amen.
reflection: This refers to all lies, especially those told under oath. God truly honors honesty! DISHONESTY cones easily, especially when complete honesty could, cost us something, make us uncomfortable, or put us in an unfavorable light.
subject: Honesty Honors God
verse_text: "People with integrity have firm footing, but those who follow crooked paths will slip and fall. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Hatred stirs up quarrels, but love covers all offenses."_

(Pro. 10:12)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our society confuses love and lust. Unlike lust, God's

kind of love is directed outward toward others, not

inward toward ourselves. God's love is utterly unselfish.

This kind of love goes against our natural inclination.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would help me set aside

my natural desires so that I can love without expecting anything

in return. I pray that I would become more like Christ, so that I

would have more love for others. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Our society confuses love and lust. Unlike lust, God's kind of love is directed outward toward others, not inward toward ourselves. God's love is utterly unselfish. This kind of love goes against our natural inclination.
original_verse_text: "Hatred stirs up quarrels, but love covers all offenses. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of Your unconditional love, which covers a multitude of sins. Help us to walk in love, as Christ loved us and gave Himself up for us, a fragrant offering and sacrifice to You. May we seek to love others selflessly, putting their needs before our own, and reflecting the unending grace and compassion that You have shown us. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Our society confuses love and lust. Unlike lust, God's kind of love is directed outward toward others, not inward toward ourselves. God's love is utterly unselfish. This kind of love goes against our natural inclination.
subject: Unselfish Love Transforms Us
verse_text: "Hatred stirs up quarrels, but love covers all offenses. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Wise people treasure knowledge, but the babbling of a fool_

_invites trouble. _(Pro. 10:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

What you say and what you don't say are both important. To use

proper speech you must NOT only say the right words at the right

time but also not say what you shouldn't.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that before I speak, I would always ask, is what

I want to say true? Is it necessary? Is it kind? . Amen.
original_reflection_text: What you say and what you don't say are both important. To use proper speech you must NOT only say the right words at the right time but also not say what you shouldn't.
original_verse_text: "Wise people treasure knowledge, but the babbling of a fool invites trouble.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking wisdom and discernment in our speech. Help us to be slow to speak and quick to listen, that our words may be few but meaningful, bringing honor and glory to Your name. May we learn to hold our tongues, speaking only what is necessary and edifying, and refraining from words that could harm or mislead. Guide us, Lord, to use our speech as a reflection of Your love and truth. Amen.
reflection: What you say and what you don't say are both important. To use proper speech you must NOT only say the right words at the right time but also not say what you shouldn't.
subject: Speak Wisely: Words Matter
verse_text: "Wise people treasure knowledge, but the babbling of a fool invites trouble.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"People who accept correction are on the pathway to life,_

_but those who ignore it will lead others astray." _(Pro. 10:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This teaching is a lamp to light the way ahead of you. Allow

this advice to guide you to the way to eternal life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always accept the correction

from Your Holy Word, so that I may never stray form the

path that leads to eternal life. Amen.
original_reflection_text: This teaching is a lamp to light the way ahead of you. Allow this advice to guide you to the way to eternal life.
original_verse_text: "People who accept correction are on the pathway to life, but those who ignore it will lead others astray. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the wisdom and guidance found in Your Word. May the light of Your truth shine brightly, illuminating the path before us and leading us ever closer to Your eternal kingdom. Help us to heed the instruction of Proverbs 10:17, that we may walk in the way of life and find the life-giving nourishment You have prepared. We trust in Your perfect plan and seek to follow where You lead. Amen.
reflection: This teaching is a lamp to light the way ahead of you. Allow this advice to guide you to the way to eternal life.
subject: Lamp to Light Your Path
verse_text: "People who accept correction are on the pathway to life, but those who ignore it will lead others astray. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"To hide hatred is to be a liar, to slander is to be a fool._

_Don't talk to much, for it fosters sin. Be sensible and turn_

_off the flow!' _(Pro. 10:18, 19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

If you try to conceal your hatred, you end up being a liar. You

can solve the problem only by, admitting your hateful feelings

to God. Ask Him to change your heart, to help you love instead

of hate.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, help me correct my attitude so that I would become

a more loving person. Amen.
original_reflection_text: If you try to conceal your hatred, you end up being a liar. You can solve the problem only by, admitting your hateful feelings to God. Ask Him to change your heart, to help you love instead of hate.
original_verse_text: To hide hatred is to be a liar, to slander is to be a fool. Don't talk to much, for it fosters sin. Be sensible and turn off the flow!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You acknowledging the sinful tendency within our hearts to harbor hatred and conceal the truth. Forgive us for the times we have been quick to speak, slow to listen, and have allowed bitterness, anger, and malice to take root. Lord, we ask that You would transform our hearts, that we might be kind, compassionate, and forgiving, even as You have forgiven us. Help us to love as You love, that our words and actions may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: If you try to conceal your hatred, you end up being a liar. You can solve the problem only by, admitting your hateful feelings to God. Ask Him to change your heart, to help you love instead of hate.
subject: Admit Hateful Feelings, Seek Change
verse_text: To hide hatred is to be a liar, to slander is to be a fool. Don't talk to much, for it fosters sin. Be sensible and turn off the flow!

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The words of the godly are like sterling sliver; _

_the heart of a fool is worthless."_ (Pro. 10:20)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A lot of poor advice is worth less than a little good advice.

It is easy to get opinions from people who will tell you only

what they think will please us, but such advice is not helpful.

Instead we should look to those who will tell us the truth,

even when it hurts. Think about the people to whom you go

for advice. What do you expect to hear from them?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that when I am asked to give

someone advice I would look to You for wisdom, and the

right words to share. Amen.
original_reflection_text: A lot of poor advice is worth less than a little good advice. It is easy to get opinions from people who will tell you only what they think will please us, but such advice is not helpful. Instead we should look to those who will tell us the truth, even when it hurts. Think about the people to whom you go for advice. What do you expect to hear from them?
original_verse_text: "The words of the godly are like sterling sliver; the heart of a fool is worthless. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the wisdom found in Your Word. Help us to discern good counsel from those who speak the truth, even when it is difficult to hear. Grant us the humility to seek out wise and godly advisors, that we may walk in Your ways and bring glory to Your name. May our hearts be receptive to the counsel of those who love You and desire to see us grow in righteousness. We trust in Your guidance, Lord. Amen.
reflection: A lot of poor advice is worth less than a little good advice. It is easy to get opinions from people who will tell you only what they think will please us, but such advice is not helpful. Instead we should look to those who will tell us the truth, even when it hurts. Think about the people to whom you go for advice. What do you expect to hear from them?
subject: Seek Wise Counsel, Not Flattery
verse_text: "The words of the godly are like sterling sliver; the heart of a fool is worthless. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"_The blessings of the Lord mak__es a man rich, and _

_he adds no sorrow with it." _(Pro. 10:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God supplies most people with the personal and financial abilities

to respond to the needs of others. If we all realize how God has

blessed us, and if we all used our resources to do God's will,

hunger and poverty would be wiped out. Wealth is a blessing

ONLY if we use it in the way God intended.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your many blessings, I pray

that I would be faithful in sharing them as You intended me to use

them. Help me to realize the needs of those who are less fortunate.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: God supplies most people with the personal and financial abilities to respond to the needs of others. If we all realize how God has blessed us, and if we all used our resources to do God's will, hunger and poverty would be wiped out. Wealth is a blessing ONLY if we use it in the way God intended.
original_verse_text: "The blessings of the Lord makes a man rich, and he adds no sorrow with it. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that every good and perfect gift comes from You (James 1:17). We thank You for the blessings You have bestowed upon us, not for our own selfish gain, but that we may use them to do Your will and care for those in need. Help us to be generous and compassionate, using our resources to alleviate the burdens of the poor and the hungry, as You have commanded (Ephesians 4:28). May our wealth be a blessing to others, and may we faithfully steward all that You have entrusted to us. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: God supplies most people with the personal and financial abilities to respond to the needs of others. If we all realize how God has blessed us, and if we all used our resources to do God's will, hunger and poverty would be wiped out. Wealth is a blessing ONLY if we use it in the way God intended.
subject: Blessings to Share Generously
verse_text: "The blessings of the Lord makes a man rich, and he adds no sorrow with it. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The fears of the wicked will all come true; _

_so will the hopes of the godly." _(Pro. 10:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The wicked person dreads death. Those who do not believe

in God usually fear death, and with good reason. By contrast,

believers desire eternal life and God's salvation---Their hopes

will be rewarded. This verse offers a choice. You can have

either your fears or your hopes come true. You make that choice

by rejecting God and living your own way or by accepting God

and following Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that this world will come to

realize that their only hope is in accepting You as their Savior

and follow You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The wicked person dreads death. Those who do not believe in God usually fear death, and with good reason. By contrast, believers desire eternal life and God's salvation---Their hopes will be rewarded. This verse offers a choice. You can have either your fears or your hopes come true. You make that choice by rejecting God and living your own way or by accepting God and following Him.
original_verse_text: "The fears of the wicked will all come true; so will the hopes of the godly. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with reverence and awe, acknowledging that You alone are the giver of life and the conqueror of death. As Your children, we cling to the promise of Psalm 23:4, that even when we walk through the valley of the shadow of death, we need not fear, for You are with us. Lord, we pray that You would deliver us from the fears and anxieties that plague the wicked, and instead, fill our hearts with the hope and assurance of eternal life in Your presence. May our desires and longings be aligned with Your will, that our hopes may be rewarded in the life to come. We trust in Your sovereign plan and ask that You would guide us in the way of righteousness, that we may walk confidently through this world, secure in the knowledge of Your unfailing love. Amen.
reflection: The wicked person dreads death. Those who do not believe in God usually fear death, and with good reason. By contrast, believers desire eternal life and God's salvation---Their hopes will be rewarded. This verse offers a choice. You can have either your fears or your hopes come true. You make that choice by rejecting God and living your own way or by accepting God and following Him.
subject: Wicked Dread Death; Believers Desire Life
verse_text: "The fears of the wicked will all come true; so will the hopes of the godly. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Disaster strikes like a cyclone, whirling the wicked away,_

_but the godly have a lasting foundation." _(Pro. 10:25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God calls His people to be morally upright, but we live

among evil people whose standards and morals are eroding.

Our standard for living should not come from our evil

society, but from God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray that I would follow the path

of righteousness so that I would not fall into the standards

of society. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God calls His people to be morally upright, but we live among evil people whose standards and morals are eroding. Our standard for living should not come from our evil society, but from God.
original_verse_text: "Disaster strikes like a cyclone, whirling the wicked away, but the godly have a lasting foundation. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the wisdom found in Your Word. Help us to walk as children of light, discerning what is pleasing to You. Grant us the strength to stand firm against the shifting sands of this world's values, that we may live according to Your righteous standards. May our lives be a reflection of Your truth and a testimony to Your glory. Amen.
reflection: God calls His people to be morally upright, but we live among evil people whose standards and morals are eroding. Our standard for living should not come from our evil society, but from God.
subject: Upright Living in Wicked World
verse_text: "Disaster strikes like a cyclone, whirling the wicked away, but the godly have a lasting foundation. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The hopes of the godly results in happiness, but the_

_expectations of the wicked are all in vain." _(Pro. 10:28)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The reason for the happiness of the godly is that the Lord

promises an eternal reward in the presence of Him. But

the reward of the ungodly is an eternal separation from

Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and

mercy, which gives all who believe a result of eternal

reward and happiness. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The reason for the happiness of the godly is that the Lord promises an eternal reward in the presence of Him. But the reward of the ungodly is an eternal separation from Him.
original_verse_text: "The hopes of the godly results in happiness, but the expectations of the wicked are all in vain. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, knowing that our true joy and fulfillment can only be found in Your presence. As the Psalmist declares, "Whom have I in heaven but You? And there is nothing on earth that I desire besides You." (Psalm 73:25) Help us to keep our eyes fixed on the eternal reward that You have promised to those who walk in Your ways, and to turn away from the fleeting pleasures of the world. May our hope be in You alone, for You are the strength of our hearts and our portion forever. (Psalm 73:26) Amen.
reflection: The reason for the happiness of the godly is that the Lord promises an eternal reward in the presence of Him. But the reward of the ungodly is an eternal separation from Him.
subject: Eternal Reward for the Godly
verse_text: "The hopes of the godly results in happiness, but the expectations of the wicked are all in vain. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Riches won't help on the day of judgment, but right _

_living is a __safeguard against death." _ (Pro. 11:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

"The day of judgment" refers to when we die or to the time

when God settles accounts with all people. On judgment day,

each of us will stand alone, accountable for all our deeds. At

that time, no amount of riches will by reconciliation with God.

Only our love for God and obedience to Him will count.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, and Savior, my prayer is that You will wipe away

all my sins, so that I may stand before You reconciled in Your

sight. Amen.
original_reflection_text: "The day of judgment" refers to when we die or to the time when God settles accounts with all people. On judgment day, each of us will stand alone, accountable for all our deeds. At that time, no amount of riches will by reconciliation with God. Only our love for God and obedience to Him will count.
original_verse_text: "Riches won't help on the day of judgment, but right living is a safeguard against death. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your righteous judgment, for on that day, our wealth and possessions will be of no avail. Help us to remember that the only thing that matters is our reverence for You and our obedience to Your commands. May we live each day with the awareness that we will one day give account for our actions. Grant us the wisdom to fear You and keep Your commandments, for this is the whole duty of man. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: "The day of judgment" refers to when we die or to the time when God settles accounts with all people. On judgment day, each of us will stand alone, accountable for all our deeds. At that time, no amount of riches will by reconciliation with God. Only our love for God and obedience to Him will count.
subject: Prepare for Judgment Day
verse_text: "Riches won't help on the day of judgment, but right living is a safeguard against death. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"When the wicked die, their hopes all perish, for they rely _

_on their own strength. God recues the godly from danger, _

_but He lets the wicked fall into trouble." _(Pro. 11:7, 8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

These verses contrast two paths in life but are not intended

to apply universally to all people in all circumstances. God's

people are not excluded from problems or struggles. If a person

follows God's wisdom, however, God can rescue them from

trouble. But a wicked person will fall into his or her own traps.

The good person may suffer, but they can be sure they will

ultimately be rescued from eternal death.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Thank You Lord, for the promise of a better place for those who
follow

You, even though they may go through difficult situations on this
earth.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: These verses contrast two paths in life but are not intended to apply universally to all people in all circumstances. God's people are not excluded from problems or struggles. If a person follows God's wisdom, however, God can rescue them from trouble. But a wicked person will fall into his or her own traps. The good person may suffer, but they can be sure they will ultimately be rescued from eternal death.
original_verse_text: "When the wicked die, their hopes all perish, for they rely on their own strength. God recuses the godly from danger, but He lets the wicked fall into trouble. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the wisdom and discernment You offer through Your Word. Help us to walk the path of righteousness, turning away from the ways of the wicked. Though we may face troubles and trials, we trust that You will rescue us from the traps of sin and death. Grant us the strength to persevere, and the courage to stand firm in Your truth. May our lives be a reflection of Your goodness and grace. Amen.
reflection: These verses contrast two paths in life but are not intended to apply universally to all people in all circumstances. God's people are not excluded from problems or struggles. If a person follows God's wisdom, however, God can rescue them from trouble. But a wicked person will fall into his or her own traps. The good person may suffer, but they can be sure they will ultimately be rescued from eternal death.
subject: Wisdom Guides, Wickedness Traps
verse_text: "When the wicked die, their hopes all perish, for they rely on their own strength. God recuses the godly from danger, but He lets the wicked fall into trouble. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Evil words destroy one's friends; wise discernment _

_rescues to godly." _(Pro. 11:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The mouth can be used in two ways, either as a weapon

or a tool, hurting relationships or building them up. Sadly

it seems easier to destroy than to build up, and most people

have received more destructive comments than those that

build up. Remember that your words today will make a

difference. will they be words that destroy or words that

build up?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would bridal my

tongue today, so that the words I speak to others would

build them up rather than tear them down. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The mouth can be used in two ways, either as a weapon or a tool, hurting relationships or building them up. Sadly it seems easier to destroy than to build up, and most people have received more destructive comments than those that build up. Remember that your words today will make a difference. will they be words that destroy or words that build up?
original_verse_text: "Evil words destroy one's friends; wise discernment rescues to godly. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, mindful of the power of our words. Help us to use our mouths as tools to build up and encourage one another, rather than as weapons to tear down and destroy. May our speech be gracious, seasoned with salt, that it may minister grace to the hearers. Guide us to speak words that edify and bring life, not those that wound and discourage. May our conversations reflect Your love and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: The mouth can be used in two ways, either as a weapon or a tool, hurting relationships or building them up. Sadly it seems easier to destroy than to build up, and most people have received more destructive comments than those that build up. Remember that your words today will make a difference. will they be words that destroy or words that build up?
subject: Speak Life-Giving Words
verse_text: "Evil words destroy one's friends; wise discernment rescues to godly. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Without wise leadership, a nation falls, with many _

_counselors, __there is safety." _(Pro. 11:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A good leader needs and uses wise counselors. One person's

perspective and understanding is severely limited. He or she

may not have all the facts or may be blinded by bias, emotions,

or wrong impressions. To be a wise leader at home, at church,

or at work seek the counsel of others and be open to their advice.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be sensitive to the good

advice or others and the leadership of Your Holy Spirit. Amen.
original_reflection_text: A good leader needs and uses wise counselors. One person's perspective and understanding is severely limited. He or she may not have all the facts or may be blinded by bias, emotions, or wrong impressions. To be a wise leader at home, at church, or at work seek the counsel of others and be open to their advice.
original_verse_text: "Without wise leadership, a nation falls, with many counselors, there is safety. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to be humble leaders, open to the counsel of others and willing to listen to their perspectives. May we not rely solely on our own limited understanding, but seek the wisdom of those around us, that we may make decisions that honor You and serve others well. Grant us discernment, that we may walk in Your ways. Amen.
reflection: A good leader needs and uses wise counselors. One person's perspective and understanding is severely limited. He or she may not have all the facts or may be blinded by bias, emotions, or wrong impressions. To be a wise leader at home, at church, or at work seek the counsel of others and be open to their advice.
subject: Seek Wise Counsel for Leadership
verse_text: "Without wise leadership, a nation falls, with many counselors, there is safety. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Godly people find life; evil people find death." _(Pro. 11:19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Godly people find life because they live life more fully

each day.They also find life because people usually live

longer when they live right, with proper diet, exercise, and

rest. In addition they need not fear death because eternal life

is God's gift to them (Jn. 11:25) By contrast, evil people not

only find eternal death but also miss out on real life on earth.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank you for the gift of eternal life that You

have promised to all who believe in You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Godly people find life because they live life more fully each day. They also find life because people usually live longer when they live right, with proper diet, exercise, and rest. In addition they need not fear death because eternal life is God's gift to them (John 11:25) By contrast, evil people not only find eternal death but also miss out on real life on earth.
original_verse_text: "Godly people find life; evil people find death. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the promise of abundant life found in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to walk in Your ways, pursuing righteousness and wisdom, that we may experience the fullness of life You have for us. May we not be consumed by the empty pursuits of this world, but find our joy and purpose in serving You. Grant us the courage to resist temptation and the strength to live according to Your will. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Godly people find life because they live life more fully each day. They also find life because people usually live longer when they live right, with proper diet, exercise, and rest. In addition they need not fear death because eternal life is God's gift to them (John 11:25) By contrast, evil people not only find eternal death but also miss out on real life on earth.
subject: Discover Life's Fullness Daily
verse_text: "Godly people find life; evil people find death. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The generous prosper and are satisfied; those who refresh _

_others will themselves be refreshed." _(Pro. 11:25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God supplies us with more so we can give more. In addition, giving

helps us gain a right perspective of our possessions. We should come

to realize they were never ours to begin with, but they were given to

us BY God to be used to help others. So what do we gain by giving?

Freedom from enslavement to our possessions, the joy of helping

others, AND GOD'S APPROVAL!

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I have to confess that I have complained,

about lean times in my life, but when I look at many others, I have

to admit, You have blest me in ways that I have not used wisely.

I ask for Your forgiveness. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God supplies us with more so we can give more. In addition, giving helps us gain a right perspective of our possessions. We should come to realize they were never ours to begin with, but they were given to us BY God to be used to help others. So what do we gain by giving? Freedom from enslavement to our possessions, the joy of helping others, AND GOD'S APPROVAL!
original_verse_text: "The generous prosper and are satisfied; those who refresh others will themselves be refreshed. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the abundance You have graciously provided us. Help us to honor You with our wealth, not hoarding it selfishly, but using it to bless others and further Your kingdom. May our generosity reflect Your own generous heart, that we might experience the freedom and joy that comes from giving. We ask this in the name of Jesus, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: God supplies us with more so we can give more. In addition, giving helps us gain a right perspective of our possessions. We should come to realize they were never ours to begin with, but they were given to us BY God to be used to help others. So what do we gain by giving? Freedom from enslavement to our possessions, the joy of helping others, AND GOD'S APPROVAL!
subject: Gain Freedom Through Giving
verse_text: "The generous prosper and are satisfied; those who refresh others will themselves be refreshed. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"If you search for good, you will find favor, but if you_

_search for evil, it will find you!" _(Pro. 11:27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Sometimes God intervenes and stops evil doers in their tracks

in order to protect His followers. At other times, for reasons

known only to Him, God allows evil to continue even though

innocent people are hurt. It is during these times that we must

ask God to protect us. Remember that God will execute final

justice, although it may not be during our life time.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, for those times that we are surround by evil, I

pray that I will continue to trust in You. May I remain

sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Sometimes God intervenes and stops evil doers in their tracks in order to protect His followers. At other times, for reasons known only to Him, God allows evil to continue even though innocent people are hurt. It is during these times that we must ask God to protect us. Remember that God will execute final justice, although it may not be during our life time.
original_verse_text: "If you search for good, you will find favor, but if you search for evil, it will find you!"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your divine protection and justice. When wickedness seems to prevail, we trust in Your sovereign plan, knowing that You will ultimately execute righteous judgment. Grant us the wisdom to wait patiently for Your timing, and the strength to persevere in the face of adversity. May our hope remain steadfast in Your unfailing love and faithfulness. We pray this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Sometimes God intervenes and stops evil doers in their tracks in order to protect His followers. At other times, for reasons known only to Him, God allows evil to continue even though innocent people are hurt. It is during these times that we must ask God to protect us. Remember that God will execute final justice, although it may not be during our life time.
subject: Trusting God in Difficult Times
verse_text: "If you search for good, you will find favor, but if you search for evil, it will find you!"

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Trust in your money and down you go! But the godly_

_ flourish __like leaves in spring." _(Pro. 11:28)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Those who have money must be generous, but they must not

be arrogant just because they have been given a lot to give.

They must be careful not to put their hope in money instead

of in the living God for their security. Even if we don't have

material wealth, we can be rich in good deeds. No matter how

poor we are, we have something to share with someone.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me realize when I am putting to

much faith in things. Help me to trust You more, and share

a good deed with someone who is needy. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Those who have money must be generous, but they must not be arrogant just because they have been given a lot to give. They must be careful not to put their hope in money instead of in the living God for their security. Even if we don't have material wealth, we can be rich in good deeds. No matter how poor we are, we have something to share with someone.
original_verse_text: Trust in your money and down you go! But the godly flourish like leaves in spring.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for Your abundant provision and the blessings You bestow upon us. Help us not to put our trust in the fleeting riches of this world, but to find our security in You, the living God. May we be rich in good deeds, generous in spirit, and willing to share what we have with those in need. Guide us to use our resources wisely and with a heart of humility, that we may lay up treasure in heaven. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Those who have money must be generous, but they must not be arrogant just because they have been given a lot to give. They must be careful not to put their hope in money instead of in the living God for their security. Even if we don't have material wealth, we can be rich in good deeds. No matter how poor we are, we have something to share with someone.
subject: Generosity Without Arrogance
verse_text: Trust in your money and down you go! But the godly flourish like leaves in spring.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Those who bring trouble on their families inherit only the _

_wind. the fool will be a servant to the wise." _(Pro. 11:29)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

One of the greatest resources God gives us is the family. Families

provide acceptance, encouragement, guidance, and counsel. Bringing

trouble on your family-----whether through anger or through an

exaggerated desire for independence----is foolish because you cut

yourself off from all they provide. In your family strive for
healing,

communication, and understanding.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for all that You provide for us, forgive me when

I take the many blessing for granted, and not give You thanks as I

should. I thank You Lord for the freedoms we have in this country

I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
original_reflection_text: One of the greatest resources God gives us is the family. Families provide acceptance, encouragement, guidance, and counsel. Bringing trouble on your family-----whether through anger or through an exaggerated desire for independence----is foolish because you cut yourself off from all they provide. In your family strive for healing, communication, and understanding.
original_verse_text: "Those who bring trouble on their families inherit only the wind. the fool will be a servant to the wise. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts for the gift of family. Help us to honor and cherish the relationships You have entrusted to us, that we may not bring trouble upon our loved ones, but rather seek healing, communication, and understanding. Guide us to walk in wisdom, submitting to one another out of reverence for Christ. May our homes be sanctuaries of Your love and grace. Amen.
reflection: One of the greatest resources God gives us is the family. Families provide acceptance, encouragement, guidance, and counsel. Bringing trouble on your family-----whether through anger or through an exaggerated desire for independence----is foolish because you cut yourself off from all they provide. In your family strive for healing, communication, and understanding.
subject: Cultivate Family Harmony
verse_text: "Those who bring trouble on their families inherit only the wind. the fool will be a servant to the wise. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"the godly are like trees that bear life-giving fruit, and _

_those who save lives are wise." _(Pro. 11:30)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The godly person is a model of a meaningful life. like a

tree that attracts people to its shade, a godly person's sense

of purpose attracts others who want to know how they, TOO,

can find meaning. Gaining wisdom yourself can be the first

step in leading people to God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord of Wisdom, Love, and Mercy, I pray that You

would instill in me a Christ like love for others that would attract

them to a meaningful life in You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The godly person is a model of a meaningful life. like a tree that attracts people to its shade, a godly person's sense of purpose attracts others who want to know how they, TOO, can find meaning. Gaining wisdom yourself can be the first step in leading people to God.
original_verse_text: "the godly are like trees that bear life-giving fruit, and those who save lives are wise. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the wisdom and understanding that comes from walking with You. May our lives be like a fruitful tree, drawing others to the shade of Your love and the nourishment of Your truth. Grant us discernment to live purposefully, that we may lead those around us to the wellspring of eternal life found in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: The godly person is a model of a meaningful life. like a tree that attracts people to its shade, a godly person's sense of purpose attracts others who want to know how they, TOO, can find meaning. Gaining wisdom yourself can be the first step in leading people to God.
subject: Meaningful Life Modeled by Godly
verse_text: "the godly are like trees that bear life-giving fruit, and those who save lives are wise. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_If the righteous are rewarded here on earth, how much more _

_true that the wicked and the sinners will get what they deserve!_

(Pro. 11:31)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Contrary to popular opinion, no one sins and gets away with it.

The righteous are rewarded for their faith. The wicked are

punished for their sins. Don't think for a moment that _"it won't_

_matter."_ or _"nobody will know,"_ or _"we won't get caught." _

For more information check (I Pet. 4:18)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray that every chance I get You would

give me THE COURAGE to correct the misbelief of those who

believe they can continue in the ways of the world with no

consequences. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Contrary to popular opinion, no one sins and gets away with it. The righteous are rewarded for their faith. The wicked are punished for their sins. Don't think for a moment that "it won't matter. " or "nobody will know, " or "we won't get caught. " For more information check (I Peter 4:18)
original_verse_text: If the righteous are rewarded here on earth, how much more true that the wicked and the sinners will get what they deserve!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that our actions and choices have consequences. Help us to walk in righteousness, not seeking to evade the consequences of our sins, but to live with integrity and faithfulness. May we never be deceived into thinking that our wrongdoings will go unnoticed or unpunished. Instead, grant us the wisdom to live according to Your ways, that we may receive the reward of eternal life. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Contrary to popular opinion, no one sins and gets away with it. The righteous are rewarded for their faith. The wicked are punished for their sins. Don't think for a moment that "it won't matter. " or "nobody will know, " or "we won't get caught. " For more information check (I Peter 4:18)
subject: Righteous Rewarded, Wicked Punished
verse_text: If the righteous are rewarded here on earth, how much more true that the wicked and the sinners will get what they deserve!

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_To learn, you must love discipline; it is stupid to hate _

_correction. _(Pro. 12:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

If you don't want to learn, years of schooling will teach you very

little. But if you want to be taught, there is no end to what you can

learn. This includes being willing to accept discipline and
correction

and to learn from the wisdom of others. A person who refuses
corrective

criticism has a problem with pride. Such a person is unlikely to
learn

very much.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, instill in me a willingness to accept Your Holy Spirit's

guidance. I pray for a sensitive spirit. Amen.
original_reflection_text: If you don't want to learn, years of schooling will teach you very little. But if you want to be taught, there is no end to what you can learn. This includes being willing to accept discipline and correction and to learn from the wisdom of others. A person who refuses corrective criticism has a problem with pride. Such a person is unlikely to learn very much.
original_verse_text: To learn, you must love discipline; it is stupid to hate correction.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble and open hearts, seeking to learn and grow in Your wisdom. Help us to be receptive to the counsel and discipline of others, for in doing so, we may gain understanding and become more like Your Son. Grant us the humility to accept correction, that our pride may not blind us to the lessons You have for us. May we ever be students, eager to learn from Your Word and the wisdom of those You have placed in our lives. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: If you don't want to learn, years of schooling will teach you very little. But if you want to be taught, there is no end to what you can learn. This includes being willing to accept discipline and correction and to learn from the wisdom of others. A person who refuses corrective criticism has a problem with pride. Such a person is unlikely to learn very much.
subject: Embrace Discipline, Expand Knowledge
verse_text: To learn, you must love discipline; it is stupid to hate correction.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_wickedness never brings stability, only the godly have deep roots._

(Pro. 12:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God calls His people to be morally upright. Our standards for living

should not come from our evil society but from God. To have deep

roots and to be stable means to be successful. Real success comes

only to those who do what is right. Their efforts stand the test of
time.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my standard of living would

always come from You Help me not be tempted by our evil

society. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God calls His people to be morally upright. Our standards for living should not come from our evil society but from God. To have deep roots and to be stable means to be successful. Real success comes only to those who do what is right. Their efforts stand the test of time.
original_verse_text: wickedness never brings stability, only the godly have deep roots.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to walk in the ways of the righteous. Help us to delight in Your law and meditate on it day and night, that we may be like trees firmly planted by streams of water, bearing fruit in due season. May our lives be grounded in Your truth, standing firm against the temptations of the world. Guide us, Lord, to live with integrity and find our true success in pleasing You. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: God calls His people to be morally upright. Our standards for living should not come from our evil society but from God. To have deep roots and to be stable means to be successful. Real success comes only to those who do what is right. Their efforts stand the test of time.
subject: Moral Uprightness Leads to Success
verse_text: wickedness never brings stability, only the godly have deep roots.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The plans of the godly are just, the advice of the wicked is_

_treacherous. _(Pro. 12:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In Mt. 12:34 Jesus reminds us that what we say reveals what we

HAVE in our heart. So the question is, what are your words revealing

about you? The only cure is, we must allow the Holy Spirit to fill

us with new attitudes and new motives, then our speech will be

cleansed at its source.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit will cleanse my heart,

instilling in me a new attitude and new motives. Amen.
original_reflection_text: In Matthew 12:34 Jesus reminds us that what we say reveals what we HAVE in our heart. So the question is, what are your words revealing about you? The only cure is, we must allow the Holy Spirit to fill us with new attitudes and new motives, then our speech will be cleansed at its source.
original_verse_text: "The plans of the godly are just, the advice of the wicked is treacherous.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that our words have the power to build up or tear down. Help us to be mindful of the thoughts and intentions of our hearts, that our speech may be seasoned with grace and truth, bringing encouragement and edification to those around us. May our words reflect the transformative work of Your Spirit within us. We pray that our lives would be a living testimony to Your goodness and love. Amen.
reflection: In Matthew 12:34 Jesus reminds us that what we say reveals what we HAVE in our heart. So the question is, what are your words revealing about you? The only cure is, we must allow the Holy Spirit to fill us with new attitudes and new motives, then our speech will be cleansed at its source.
subject: Cleansed Speech Reveals Transformed Heart
verse_text: "The plans of the godly are just, the advice of the wicked is treacherous.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The wicked perish and are gone, but the children_

_of the godly stand firm. _(Pro. 12:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In the middle of this gloomy message, God gives hope. Eventually the

righteous will receive God's reward, and the wicked will receive
their

punishment. Let us keep on holding to God's truth and take heart!

God will bring about justice in the end, and He will reward those who

have been faithful.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, forgive me when I become disheartened when_ _see the
wicked

prosper. Help me to remember that You are the Judge, and each person

will receive their due reward. Amen.
original_reflection_text: In the middle of this gloomy message, God gives hope. Eventually the righteous will receive God's reward, and the wicked will receive their punishment. Let us keep on holding to God's truth and take heart! God will bring about justice in the end, and He will reward those who have been faithful.
original_verse_text: The wicked perish and are gone, but the children of the godly stand firm.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, clinging to the hope found in Your Word. Though the wicked may seem to prosper for a time, we trust that Your justice will prevail. Help us to remain steadfast in our faith, for even when we fall, You will raise us up. Grant us the strength to persevere, knowing that those who are righteous in Your sight will ultimately be rewarded. May we find comfort in the promise that the righteous will not be abandoned, but will receive Your eternal blessing. Amen.
reflection: In the middle of this gloomy message, God gives hope. Eventually the righteous will receive God's reward, and the wicked will receive their punishment. Let us keep on holding to God's truth and take heart! God will bring about justice in the end, and He will reward those who have been faithful.
subject: Righteous Receive God's Reward
verse_text: The wicked perish and are gone, but the children of the godly stand firm.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Every one admires a person with good sense, but a warped

mind is despised.

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Wisdom is the ability to see life from God's perspective and

then to know the best course of action to take. Most people

would agree that wisdom is a valuable asset, but how can we

acquire it? (Pro. 9:10) teaches that the fear of the Lord (respect

and honor) is the beginning of Wisdom.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always take the advice of,

Proverbs 9:10. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Wisdom is the ability to see life from God's perspective and then to know the best course of action to take. Most people would agree that wisdom is a valuable asset, but how can we acquire it? (Proverbs 9:10) teaches that the fear of the Lord (respect and honor) is the beginning of Wisdom.
original_verse_text: Every one admires a person with good sense, but a warped mind is despised.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking the wisdom that comes from above. Grant us the understanding to see life through Your eyes, that we may walk in the path of righteousness and discernment. Instill in us the fear of the Lord, for it is the foundation of true wisdom. May we treasure Your counsel and find shelter in Your understanding, that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Wisdom is the ability to see life from God's perspective and then to know the best course of action to take. Most people would agree that wisdom is a valuable asset, but how can we acquire it? (Proverbs 9:10) teaches that the fear of the Lord (respect and honor) is the beginning of Wisdom.
subject: Cultivate Godly Wisdom Today
verse_text: Every one admires a person with good sense, but a warped mind is despised.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_It is better to be a nobody with a servant than to be_

_self-important but have no food. _(Pro. 12:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

How can we humble ourselves? Some people try to give

the appearance of humility in order to manipulate others.

Some think that humility means putting themselves down.

Truly humble people compare themselves only with Christ,

they realize their sinfulness, and understand their limitations.

Humility is not self-degradation; it is realistic self-assessment

and commitment to serve.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will always make an honest

self-assessment of my self and an honest commitment to serve

others. Amen.
original_reflection_text: How can we humble ourselves? Some people try to give the appearance of humility in order to manipulate others. Some think that humility means putting themselves down. Truly humble people compare themselves only with Christ, they realize their sinfulness, and understand their limitations. Humility is not self-degradation; it is realistic self-assessment and commitment to serve.
original_verse_text: It is better to be a nobody with a servant than to be self-important but have no food.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging our sinfulness and limitations. Help us to walk in true humility, not seeking our own glory, but rather considering the needs of others above our own. May we find our worth not in the opinions of others, but in Your love and grace. Guide us to serve with selflessness, that we may bring honor and glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: How can we humble ourselves? Some people try to give the appearance of humility in order to manipulate others. Some think that humility means putting themselves down. Truly humble people compare themselves only with Christ, they realize their sinfulness, and understand their limitations. Humility is not self-degradation; it is realistic self-assessment and commitment to serve.
subject: Cultivate Genuine Humility
verse_text: It is better to be a nobody with a servant than to be self-important but have no food.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The wicked are trapped by their own words, but the godly escape _

_such trouble. _(Pro. 12:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Sinful people twist the facts to support their claims. Those who do

this will eventually be trapped by their own lies. But for those who

always tell the truth, the facts, plain and unvarnished, give an
unshakable

defense. If you find you always have to defend yourself to others,
may

be a sign that you are not always being honest.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Spirit would always guide me

in the way of the truth. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Sinful people twist the facts to support their claims. Those who do this will eventually be trapped by their own lies. But for those who always tell the truth, the facts, plain and unvarnished, give an unshakable defense. If you find you always have to defend yourself to others, may be a sign that you are not always being honest.
original_verse_text: The wicked are trapped by their own words, but the godly escape such trouble.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the temptation to twist the truth for our own gain. Help us to resist the lure of deceit and instead embrace the power of honesty, even when it is difficult. May our words and actions always reflect the light of Your truth, that we may stand firm in Your defense and not be trapped by our own lies. Guide us to walk in the way of righteousness, that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Sinful people twist the facts to support their claims. Those who do this will eventually be trapped by their own lies. But for those who always tell the truth, the facts, plain and unvarnished, give an unshakable defense. If you find you always have to defend yourself to others, may be a sign that you are not always being honest.
subject: Unvarnished Truth Provides Unshakable Defense
verse_text: The wicked are trapped by their own words, but the godly escape such trouble.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_People can get many good things by the words they say; the works_

_of their hands also give them many benefits. _

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In the middle of what has been a gloomy message, God gives hope.

Eventually the righteous will receive God's reward, and the wicked

will receive their punishment. So let us keep holding on to God's

truth and take heart! God will bring about justice in the end, and He

will reward those who have been faithful.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the reward that You have

promised to those who are faithful. Amen.
original_reflection_text: In the middle of what has been a gloomy message, God gives hope. Eventually the righteous will receive God's reward, and the wicked will receive their punishment. So let us keep holding on to God's truth and take heart! God will bring about justice in the end, and He will reward those who have been faithful.
original_verse_text: People can get many good things by the words they say; the works of their hands also give them many benefits.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, clinging to the promise of Your eternal justice and righteousness. Help us to remain steadfast in our faith, even when the path ahead seems dark and uncertain. May we find comfort in the assurance that those who sow righteousness will reap a sure reward, while the wicked will face the consequences of their actions. Lord, strengthen our resolve to walk in Your ways, that we may bear the fruit of our labor and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: In the middle of what has been a gloomy message, God gives hope. Eventually the righteous will receive God's reward, and the wicked will receive their punishment. So let us keep holding on to God's truth and take heart! God will bring about justice in the end, and He will reward those who have been faithful.
subject: Righteous Receive God's Reward
verse_text: People can get many good things by the words they say; the works of their hands also give them many benefits.
